title: `~=` version constraints (PEP 440) do not correctly set the lower version
body:

## Issue
<!-- Now feel free to write your issue, but please be descriptive! Thanks again ðŸ™Œ â¤ï¸ -->

Found this while fixing handling of pre-release (#1150)

PEP 440 says
- `~=V.N` maps to `>= V.N, == V.*`

Examples
```
~= 2.2
>= 2.2, == 2.*

~= 1.4.5
>= 1.4.5, == 1.4.*

~= 2.2.0
>= 2.2.0, == 2.2.*

~= 1.4.5.0
>= 1.4.5.0, == 1.4.5.*
```

but looking at the tests `~=3.5.3` maps to `>=3.5.0, < 3.6` when it should map to `>=3.5.3, <3.6`. The trailing `3` should be setting the floor for the version
